pull_request.body:
<!-- # Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [ ] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons  share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment



2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>



</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>



</details>

### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met
-->

<!-- # Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [ ] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons  share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment



2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>



</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>



</details>

### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met
-->

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.dell.com/support/order-status/de-de/order-detail?v=](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dell.com%2Fsupport%2Forder-status%2Fde-de%2Forder-detail%3Fv%3D) ### Comment Username: @Morku > It's impossible to track your item with AdGuard for Windows. The side Pop-up does not appear (instead: endless loading circle). > Due several personal information on the page, I can't provide the whole URL. > The issue is only with AdGuard for Windows, not the Extension. Disabling Ad blocking, privacy, internet security and extension does not fix the issue. I have to disable AdGuard for Windows entirely to make it work. > Remembered from a similar issue with `ebay.com` I have tested provided filters and only the combination of `@@||dell.com^$jsinject,elemhide,extension` does fix the issue. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/NyTSuib.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/GI1mWm6.png)

comment.body:
These buttons are part of the website's functionality and only appear when website is scrolled up, so I'm not sure if it should be blocked.

Please add this rule:
```adblock
blog.livedoor.jp###ld-floating-menu
```
to user rules.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/93604#issuecomment-921854299

The side Pop-up does not appear (instead: endless loading circle). > Due several personal information on the page, I can't provide the whole URL. > The issue is only with AdGuard for Windows, not the Extension. Disabling Ad blocking, privacy, internet security and extension does not fix the issue. I have to disable AdGuard for Windows entirely to make it work. > Remembered from a similar issue with `ebay.com` I have tested provided filters and only the combination of `@@||dell.com^$jsinject,elemhide,extension` does fix the issue. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
It seems that unfortunately it cannot be checked without the order and if possible I would prefer to add more specific rule.
@Morku Could you please check if this rule works:
```adblock
@@||dell.com^$jsinject,elemhide,extension,xmlhttprequest
```
If so, could you please open website, then open filtering log (in the filtering please check to show only `HTML` elements), click on the button to reproduce issue and make a screenshot of the filtering (without personal information)?

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![b](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29574622/218407508-9fbc5573-eb4f-44b9-b3f9-d271fa76dd94.gif)

comment.body:
> Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it. Does it work correctly if you add this rule:
> 
> ```
> @@||bing.com/fd/ls/
> ```
> 
> to user rules?

Sorry about it. Looks like not an issue of Adguard. Only working in Edge + Private mode for me. But for some reason not working in Firefox in either mode and not even in a fresh Chrome portable version in either mode. Don't know what's the problem.

issue.title: Integrate AGLint
issue.body:
Integration of the first version of AGLint to validate adblock rules. Currently, there aren't too many linter rules (yet). Therefore, in the first round, mainly syntax errors are filtered.

@ameshkov I'll submit the Husky pre-commit hook in another PR if needed.

comment.body: @ameshkov Added, but please note that the workflow badge will only appear after the first run

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142683#issue-1581169052 - Please enable `AdGuard Chinese` filter.

<hr>

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142683#issuecomment-1427073310 - It seems that it's caused by `ADgk Mobile China list`, so please disable this filter list or add this rule:
```adblock
bilibili.com$@$div[class="-ad-"]
```
to user rules.

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

3.6.54

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

https://www.cnet.com/culture/entertainment/netflixs-password-sharing-crackdown-has-come-everything-to-know/

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List, Legitimate URL Shortener

_No response_

Login error

comment.body:
It's hard to say, but I can't reproduce it with `advanced protection`.
Try to do next:
1. Update the filters. Do not close the app ~ 1 min.
2. Restart Safari.
3. Open the site.

If that does not help.
1. Restart web extensions in Safari settings and then the Safari.
2. Open the site.

@BlazDT @AdamWr please take a look at this.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.instagram.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2F) ### Comment Username: @markandrewfrey > With Adguard on, when you come to where there would be an ad, the screen goes blank and you can't scroll past that point. Or as you scroll it just keeps jumping back to before where the ad would be and again you can't scroll further down the page. In other words, with Adguard on, you can only view the first several posts before the page just doesn't work anymore. This happens on my Chromebook and on my Windows PC both using the Chrome browser. On Android, while viewing Instagram in the Chrome browser (not the app), Adguard still works perfectly. ### Screenshots
